dish_description: Croque monsieur is a classic French bistro sandwich made with ham and cheese, typically Gruyere, sandwiched between slices of bread and baked until the cheese is melted and the bread is toasted. It can be served as a main dish or cut into smaller pieces for hors d'oeuvres.

cooking_steps.description: Trim the edges of the croque monsieur and cut each sandwich in half. For hors d'oeuvres, cut each half into 6 to 8 smaller pieces to serve as bite-sized appetizers.
